content:
Phishing Risk Analysis

Our analysis of the URL "http://secure-paypal.com.verification.dunsguide.org" has revealed a very high phishing risk score of 97. This strongly indicates that the website is likely a fraudulent attempt to steal your personal information. This URL masquerades as a secure PayPal verification site, but several key indicators reveal its deceptive nature.

Key Risk Indicators

    • Suspicious Domain Name: The URL uses "dunsguide.org" as its primary domain, while attempting to mimic PayPal with "secure-paypal.com.verification" as a subdomain. Legitimate PayPal sites use "paypal.com" as their root domain. This tactic is commonly used by phishers to trick users into thinking they are on a trusted website.
      • Unsecure Protocol (HTTP): The URL uses "http" instead of "https." Secure websites, especially those handling financial transactions, should always use HTTPS, which encrypts communication between your browser and the website. The absence of HTTPS is a major red flag.
        • Lengthy and Complex URL: Phishers often use long, complex URLs to obfuscate the actual website address and make it harder for users to recognize the deception. Legitimate verification links from reputable companies are typically shorter and more straightforward.

      Technical Assessment

      The URL structure itself reveals the deceptive intent. The attackers are leveraging the "dunsguide.org" domain and creating a subdomain structure that includes "secure-paypal.com.verification." This creates the illusion of being connected to PayPal, when in reality, the user would be directed to a server controlled by the attackers. The lack of HTTPS further exposes any submitted information to interception. While we don't have specific SSL certificate information in the provided data, the absence of HTTPS inherently means there's no secure encrypted connection.

      What This Means For You

      If you were to access this website and enter your PayPal credentials, login information, or any other personal details, that information could be stolen by the phishers. This could lead to unauthorized access to your PayPal account, financial losses, identity theft, and other serious consequences.

      Recommended Actions

        • Do not click on this link: Avoid interacting with this URL in any way. Do not click on it, hover over it, or attempt to access it.
          • Report the phishing attempt: Report this URL to PhishGuard and to PayPal directly. This helps protect other users from falling victim to the same scam.
            • Verify website authenticity directly: If you need to access PayPal, always type the URL "paypal.com" directly into your browser or use a trusted bookmark. Never access sensitive websites through links received in emails or messages.
              • Educate yourself about phishing: Learning to recognize common phishing tactics can significantly reduce your risk of becoming a victim. Look for suspicious domain names, unusual URL structures, lack of HTTPS, and requests for sensitive information.
